title: Sonnet 60 - "nothing stands but for his scythe..."

content.question: Line 12, “And nothing stands but for his scythe to mow,” is best paraphrased as

choices.label: nature both exalts and mocks human beings
everything exists only to be destroyed
external beauty is fleeting but internal beauty persists

content.answer: everything exists only to be destroyed

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain the function of specific words and phrases in a text.
